channel.title: Help with this error please
channel.description: Okay so the server runs, but every once in awhile all players that are online, get force logged off, and cannot log in until server has been restarted. I'm not sure if this is occurring because of the Stacktrace, whatever that is(if you can tell me I'd be thankful)or if it's just coincidental? But any way here is the pictures of the Error in CMD. Using DarkQuest Source. [IMG]http://i31.photobucket.com/albums/c354/GIR_DOG/errorcmd.jpg[/img] Here is the line of code in which the error is occurring. [IMG]http://i31.photobucket.com/albums/c354/GIR_DOG/errorline.jpg[/img]

item.title: Help with this error please
item.dc:creator: @Fear_Nuture Fear Nuture
item.description:
@Fear_Nuture wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:8, topic:434774”][quote author=Fear Nuture link=topic=537490.msg3931188#msg3931188 date=1330693776]
I think i figured out the problem. in GameEngine.java it was reporting suspicious players, sending logout packet, but not destroying character.
I’ve got another question however. in DQ source, how do i make client updating mandatory? I’ve changed it client side(util/config.java) and server side(server.conf).
[/quote]
man you just own this help board…

make the server check the clients version upon login[/quote]

I know I do It just makes me feel so special.
OT: where would I make it check the version number?
and what is this in GameWindowMiddleMan.java Client-side
private static final long serialVersionUID = ###################L;
replaced with ### cause idk if it should be public or not as i’ve no clue to what it is.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with this error please
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“Fear Nuture, post:7, topic:434774”]I think i figured out the problem. in GameEngine.java it was reporting suspicious players, sending logout packet, but not destroying character.
I’ve got another question however. in DQ source, how do i make client updating mandatory? I’ve changed it client side(util/config.java) and server side(server.conf).[/quote]
man you just own this help board…

make the server check the clients version upon login

Read full topic

item.title: Help with this error please
item.dc:creator: @Fear_Nuture Fear Nuture
item.description:
@Fear_Nuture wrote:

I think i figured out the problem. in GameEngine.java it was reporting suspicious players, sending logout packet, but not destroying character.
I’ve got another question however. in DQ source, how do i make client updating mandatory? I’ve changed it client side(util/config.java) and server side(server.conf).

item.title: Help with this error please
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

Fear Nuture:

I don’t remember touchin menuhandler

Are you sure all players get logout?

To me what it looks like is that something is setting your character suspicious and that is causing the exception.

if (menuHandler == null) { player.setSuspiciousPlayer(true); return; }

if you look at rev.70 changeset he added a cme exception fix http://www.assembla.com/code/darkquest/subversion/changesets/70#ch16

Read full topic

item.title: Help with this error please
item.dc:creator: @Fear_Nuture Fear Nuture
item.description:
@Fear_Nuture wrote:

[quote=“latifundio, post:2, topic:434774”]To me seems like you got problems with the menureplyhandler, are you using the last revision?

that’s pretty weird since i don’t that piece of code on it MenuReplyHandler.java

maybe you could do a checkout of the rev.69 to get rid of the status control panel, then manually add the other fixes to the source?[/quote]

That’s GameEngine class lol

Read full topic

item.title: Help with this error please
item.dc:creator: @amfg amfg
item.description:
@amfg wrote:

[quote=“Fear Nuture, post:3, topic:434774”][quote author=latifundio link=topic=537490.msg3930245#msg3930245 date=1330615720]
To me seems like you got problems with the menureplyhandler, are you using the last revision?

that’s pretty weird since i don’t that piece of code on it MenuReplyHandler.java

maybe you could do a checkout of the rev.69 to get rid of the status control panel, then manually add the other fixes to the source?
[/quote]

I don’t remember touchin menuhandler but yeah i got rev.69. what is stacktrace?[/quote]

A stack trace is what is shown in your screenshot. It shows the line which caused the exception as well as the calls to it.

Read full topic
